item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 26, 2025 at 3:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Watching o3 guess a photo's location is surreal, dystopian and entertaining (118 points | 80 comments)
2. Show HN: My self-written hobby OS is finally running on my vintage IBM ThinkPad (58 points | 12 comments)
3. An end to all this prostate trouble? (233 points | 108 comments)
4. LLMs can see and hear without any training (69 points | 16 comments)
5. Cloth (311 points | 38 comments)
6. Stuffed-Na(a)N: stuff your NaNs (13 points | 2 comments)
7. Australian who ordered radioactive materials walks away from court (122 points | 139 comments)
8. The Friendship Recession: The Lost Art of Connecting (194 points | 123 comments)
9. Thank you for holding my duck (2021) (8 points | 1 comment)
10. ICE Deports 3 U.S. Citizen Children Held Incommunicado Prior to the Deportation (255 points | 134 comments)
11. I wrote a book called "Crap Towns". It seemed funny at the time (312 points | 222 comments)
12. Freshpaint (YC S19) is hiring back end and front end engineers (Remote, US only) ( | hide)
13. Berkeley Humanoid Lite – Open-source robot (204 points | 19 comments)
14. Writing "/etc/hosts" breaks the Substack editor (587 points | 317 comments)
15. Lossless LLM compression for efficient GPU inference via dynamic-length float (373 points | 108 comments)
16. Wikipedia’s nonprofit status questioned by D.C. U.S. attorney (691 points | 616 comments)
17. Catastrophic fires and soil degradation: possible link with Neolithic revolution (6 points | 1 comment)
18. Will the Humanities Survive Artificial Intelligence? (10 points | 13 comments)
19. Mobygratis – Free Moby music to empower your creative projects (79 points | 19 comments)
20. Parallel ./configure (150 points | 119 comments)
21. World Emulation via Neural Network (212 points | 37 comments)
22. The NNCPNET Email Network (7 points | 1 comment)
23. Show HN: I used OpenAI's new image API for a personalized coloring book service (265 points | 142 comments)
24. Reproducibility project fails to validate dozens of biomedical studies (230 points | 108 comments)
25. Eurorack Knob Idea (294 points | 108 comments)
26. Show HN: Formalizing Principia Mathematica using Lean (154 points | 31 comments)
27. A $20k American-made electric pickup with no paint, no stereo, no screen (1271 points | 1110 comments)
28. Reading RSS content is a skilled activity (88 points | 46 comments)
29. Mike Lindell's lawyers used AI to write brief–judge finds nearly 30 mistakes (113 points | 77 comments)
30. Avoiding skill atrophy in the age of AI (257 points | 269 comments)
